title: Continuous Testing does not factor in dependency module tests contradicting quarkus.test.only-test-application-module description
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm trying to run tests of one of my modules through continuous testing, but by default, only my application tests are running.

I stumbled across 

![image](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/assets/1553757/0d3cc48c-606b-4e7a-92fd-bf19066f8828)

which says `If this is true then only the tests from the main application module will be run (i.e. the module that is currently running mvn quarkus:dev). If this is false then tests from all dependency modules will be run as well.`.

As it is false by default (and even if I additionally set it explicitly to false) it does never factor in module tests.

Am I getting something wrong about the default behavior?


(might be somehow related to the problems of https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/35227)

### Expected behavior

Either to run module tests by default or to let one enable it with the flag.
